New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder extended its win streak to a franchise-record 13 in a row.
Key Match Events: The Oklahoma City Thunder collected a 116-98 win over the LA Clippers.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander finished with an efficient 29 points.
Jalen Williams scored 18 points thanks to a hot second half.
Isaiah Hartenstein stuffed the stat sheet with a near 11-point triple-double.
Amir Coffey led the Clippers with 26 points on 10-of-14 shooting and went 6-of-8 from 3.
The Thunder outscored the Clippers 42-20 in the third quarter to flip the scoreboard.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder took care of business after a sloppy start and turned this into a lopsided win thanks to a dominating third quarter.
The depleted Clippers were light work for Gilgeous-Alexander. He didn't need to go at full speed to put them away.
